cities.title: Tokyo
cities.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government.

cities.title: Kyoto
cities.description: Kyoto is a city located in the central part of the island of Honshu, Japan. It has a population close to 1.5 million. Formerly the Imperial capital of Japan for more than one thousand years, it is now the capital city of Kyoto Prefecture located in the Kansai region, as well as a major part of the Kyoto-Osaka-Kobe metropolitan area.

cities.title: Osaka
cities.description: Osaka is a designated city in the Kansai region of Japan. It is the capital city of Osaka Prefecture and the largest component of the Keihanshin Metropolitan Area, the second largest metropolitan area in Japan and among the largest in the world with over 19 million inhabitants.

cities.title: Hiroshima
cities.description: Hiroshima is the capital of Hiroshima Prefecture and the largest city in the Chūgoku region of western Honshu - the largest island of Japan.

cities.title: Kobe
cities.description: Kobe is the sixth-largest city in Japan and the capital city of Hyōgo Prefecture. It is located on the southern side of the main island of Honshū, on the north shore of Osaka Bay and about 30 km (19 mi) west of Osaka. With a population around 1.5 million, the city is part of the Keihanshin metropolitan area along with Osaka and Kyoto

cities.title: Hokkaido
cities.description: Hakodate is a city and port located in Oshima Subprefecture, Hokkaido, Japan. It is the capital city of Oshima Subprefecture.

cities.title: Kabazawa
cities.description: Kanazawa is the capital city of Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan. It has a population of 462,478 and an area of 467.77 km2.

cities.title: Taipei
cities.description: Taipei, officially known as Taipei City, is the capital and a special municipality of Taiwan (officially known as the Republic of China,

cities.title: Kaohsiung
cities.description: Kaohsiung City is a special municipality located in southern-western Taiwan and facing the Taiwan Strait.

cities.title: Tainan
cities.description: Tainan is the oldest city on the island of Taiwan and also commonly known as the
for its over 200 years of history as the capital of Taiwan under Koxinga and later Qing dynasty rule.

cities.title: Taichung
cities.description: Located in the Taichung Basin in central Taiwan, the name of the city was created under Japanese rule, and became a major economic and cultural hub.

cities.title: Hsinchu
cities.description: Hsinchu is popularly nicknamed
for its windy climate. Hsinchu is administered as a provincial city within Taiwan.

cities.title: Beijing
cities.description: As a city combining both modern and traditional architecture, Beijing is a megacity rich in history, exemplified in its global influence in politics, economy, education, history, culture, and technology.

cities.title: Chongqing
cities.description: Chongqing has a significant history and culture and serves as the economic centre of the upstream Yangtze basin. It is a major manufacturing centre and transportation hub; a July 2012 report by the Economist Intelligence Unit described it as one of China's

cities.title: Shanghai
cities.description: As a major administrative, shipping and trading city, Shanghai grew in importance in the 19th century due to trade and recognition of its favourable port location and economic potential.

cities.title: Tianjin
cities.description: The walled city of Tianjin was built in 1404. As a treaty port since 1860, Tianjin has been a major seaport and gateway to Beijing.

cities.title: Foshan
cities.description: Foshan is regarded as the home of the Cantonese forms of Chinese opera, kung fu, lion dancing.

cities.title: Guilin
cities.description: It is situated on the west bank of the Li River and borders Hunan to the north. Its name means
, owing to the large number of fragrant sweet osmanthus trees located in the city.

cities.title: Nanjing
cities.description: Situated in the Yangtze River Delta region, Nanjing has a prominent place in Chinese history and culture, having served as the capital of various Chinese dynasties, kingdoms and republican governments dating from the 3rd century to 1949, and has thus long been a major center of culture, education, research, politics, economy, transport networks and tourism, being the home to one of the world's largest inland ports.
